data: {"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3124544,"name":"Asher Olgeirson","username":"Cynosure","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cynosure/{size}/184875_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-12T19:16:27.114Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eSo in the limelight docs it talks about the \u003ccode\u003ebotpose\u003c/code\u003e key in the network tables API and how it can can determine the robot’s position based on apriltags. On the default dashboard it returns a comma separated list of doubles, however, when I try to acess the value using \u003ccode\u003estd::cout \u0026lt;\u0026lt; m_table-\u0026gt;GetNumber(\"botpose\", 0.0) \u0026lt;\u0026lt; \"\\n\";\u003c/code\u003e it returns 0 no matter what. Does anyone know how I can get the values and what type it returns? The only thing regarding it I could find in the \u003ca href=\"https://docs.limelightvision.io/en/latest/networktables_api.html\" rel=\"noopener nofollow ugc\"\u003edocs\u003c/a\u003e doesn’t really explain what exactly \u003ccode\u003ebotpose\u003c/code\u003e returns.\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":34,"updated_at":"2023-01-12T19:56:34.169Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":737,"reads":308,"readers_count":307,"score":3736.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":422727,"topic_slug":"questions-about-limelights-botpose-features-only-returning-0","display_username":"Asher We visualized the network tables in both Shuffleboard and Outline Viewer and the array for botpose will be empty if no tag is in view, and will be an array of 6 zeros if any tag is in view. class=\"badge-category__name\"\u003eProgramming\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n  \u003c/div\u003e\n  \u003cblockquote\u003e\n    As I have been testing the LimeLight the past week I created this library to make the LimeLight behave more like any other object we use on our robots. Instructions are in the README for manual install. Also there is a sample Basic robot code and my CommandBase code that I used to test the setters and getters. \nIts currently only for Java, (if someone would like to create the C++ side please help) It will work for the LimeLight V1 and next gen since it simplely creates the NetworkTables read/wri…\n  \u003c/blockquote\u003e\n\u003c/aside\u003e\n\n\u003cp\u003eprivate DoubleArraySubscriber camtransub;\u003cbr\u003e\nprivate DoubleArraySubscriber posesub;\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cpre\u003e\u003ccode\u003eprivate Translation3d tran3d;\nprivate Rotation3d r3d;\nprivate Pose3d p3d;\n\n/**\n * Using the Default Lime Light NT table\n */\npublic LimeLight() {\n    m_tableName = \"limelight\";\n    m_table = NetworkTableInstance.getDefault().getTable(m_tableName);\n    posesub = m_table.getDoubleArrayTopic(\"botpose\").subscribe(new double[] {});\n\u003c/code\u003e\u003c/pre\u003e\n\u003cp\u003epublic Pose3d getRobotPose() {\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cpre\u003e\u003ccode\u003e    double[] result = posesub.get();\n    tran3d = new Translation3d(result[0], result[1], result[2]);\n    r3d = new Rotation3d(result[3], result[4], result[5]);\n    p3d = new Pose3d(tran3d, r3d);\n\n    return
